page.title: 01Coast & Farms W Kintyre
page.content: This is an area of great natural beauty where wildlife exists in abundance. The land has been farmed for many generations by the same families using largely traditional methods, modern techniques only adopted where not precluded by the demands of the area. The dairy farm is the main feature locally but sheep & beef rearing are also prominent with some arable usage for winter feed forestry commission plantations appear on the upper slopes. The shore is beaten by atlantic gales. Practically uninhabited & uncommercialised it attracts the discerning visitor all year. There is a strong community identity and little will have changed in the last twenty years despite the presence of RAF & US naval personnel nearby. Kilchenzie is a residential hamlet
